NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: research and development services and related consultancy services
quantity surveying services for civil engineering works
urban planning and landscape architectural services
technical testing, analysis and consultancy services
IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support
business services: law, marketing, consulting, recruitment, printing and security

CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries

CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ADDRESS: Corporate Procurement Division, Zone 2 D Floor, Ashdown House

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: UK-St Leonards-Provision of transport – related technical and engineering advice, consultancy and research.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Engineering services. Radio broadcast transmission services. Architectural and related services. Civil engineering consultancy services. Transport systems consultancy services. Highways consultancy services. Railway engineering services. Infrastructure works consultancy services. Health and safety consultancy services. Quantity surveying services for civil engineering works. Geotechnical engineering services. Urban planning and landscape architectural services. Construction consultancy services. Technical testing, analysis and consultancy services. Technical analysis or consultancy services. Laboratory services. IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support. Systems and technical consultancy services. Research and development services and related consultancy services. Research services. Marine research services. Research consultancy services. Business services: law, marketing, consulting, recruitment, printing and security. Market research services. Economic research services. Environmental issues consultancy services. Framework Agreement for the provision of a wide range of transport-related technical and engineering advice, consultancy and research services in respect of road, rail, air and water transport in support of the policy and business of the Department, its agencies and NDPBs, and by agreement with all parties, other public sector organisations within the UK.

The framework agreement(s) shall be for use by or on behalf of the Department, its Executive Agencies and Non Departmental Public Bodies, and by other UK public sector bodies (and their statutory successors and organisations created as a result of re-organisation or organisational changes), as listed in SI 2006 No5 at: http://www.opsi.gov.uk/si/si2006/20060005.htm.

— Central Government Departments, Executive Agencies and NDPBs http://www.direct.gov.uk/en/Dl1/Directories/A-ZOfCentralGovernment/index.htm http://www.civilservice.gov.uk/my-civil-service/networks/regional/index.aspx,
— Technology Strategy Board - http://www.innovateuk.org – where the work is funded by the Department,
— Rail Safety and Standards Board (RSSB) http://www.rssb.co.uk/whoweare/index.asp – where the work is funded by the Department,
— Scottish Public Bodies and Local Authorities http://www.scotland.gov.uk/Topics/Government/public-bodies/about/Bodies.
Welsh Public Bodies and Local Authorities http://new.wales.gov.uk.
Northern Ireland Public Sector Bodies and Local Authorities http://www.northernireland.gov.uk.

F02_ANNEX_B.LOT_TITLE: General transport related technical and engineering advice, consultancy and research.
Technical engineering advice, consultancy and research related to road transport, vehicles, highway operations, traffic information and infrastructure
Technical and engineering advice, consultancy and research related to rail transport, rail operations, rolling stock and rail infrastructure.
Transport related social research and evaluation.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: The Services will be required in respect of all aspects of road, rail, air and water transport (public and private) including but not limited to technical and engineering advice, consultancy and research in respect of:
Transport networks and infrastructure; transport-related engineering, technology, construction and geotechnical services; transport management and signalling; transport usage, policy and programmes;

Transport related environmental and sustainability issues; transport related health, safety and other human advice and research; risk management; accident investigation; incident management; transport security;
Transport related public engagement and consultation; user behaviour, quantitative and qualitative social and market research; process and impact evaluation of transport interventions (ex post);

Transport related economic, statistical and financial analysis and advice; value management; cost and risk assessments and compensation events; transport, financial and related modelling; strategic transport planning; project and programme management; regulatory advice, standards and support.
The services described may be required separately or in respect of multi-modal and cross-cutting issues.
The services to be provided shall include (but not be limited to):

(i) oral and written consultancy and specialist/academic research, research management and advice and services; production of standards, manuals, guidance and reports (for internal and external use and/or publication); design-related work, contract advice, IT systems, data collection, databases, policy, modelling and analysis; development of standards, advice notes, publicity material and research tools; undertaking qualitative and quantitative research; secondary data analyses; evidence reviews (including systematic reviews); meta analyses; value for money assessments
(ii) meetings, presentations, training, seminars and workshops, on-site advice and support, investigations, and consultancy;

(iii) project and programme management including the supply of individual professional and specialist consultants, engineers, project managers and experts, including academics, to provide on-going and ad hoc advice, input and support to client teams.

Estimated value (excl. VAT) – Total estimated value is 300 000 000 GBP (total value of all Lots over duration of framework); it should be noted that this is only an estimate of the work to be ordered, and the Department does not bind itself to demand any quantities.

The primary users of this Framework will be the Department for transport (central department) and its biggest executive agency, the highways agency. The Department’s other Agencies and non departmental bodies may also make use of this framework. The estimated total value over the potential 4 year period is 225 000 000 GBP for the Department, agencies and NDPBs. In addition a further 75 000 000 GBP may be ordered by other public bodies as shown under ll.1.5.
Information about Lots: It is expected that up to six suppliers may be appointed in each Lot.

DEPOSITS_GUARANTEES_REQUIRED.P: Applicants invited to tender will be advised.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: Applicants invited to tender will be advised, but tenders are to be priced in Sterling and payment will only be made in sterling.

LEGAL_FORM.P: The group will be required to nominate a lead partner with whom the Department can contract, or form themselves into a single legal entity before the contract is awarded.

EXISTENCE_OTHER_PARTICULAR_CONDITIONS.P: Ultimate Parent Company Guarantees may be sought.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: Applicants should provide a completed pre-qualification questionnaire (PQQ) in accordance with Vl.3 below.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Applicants should provide a completed pre-qualification questionnaire (PQQ) in accordance with Vl.3 below.

EAF_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: Applicants should provide a completed pre-qualification questionnaire (PQQ) in accordance with Vl.3 below.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Applicants should provide a completed pre-qualification questionnaire (PQQ) in accordance with Vl.3 below.

T_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: Applicants should provide a completed pre-qualification questionnaire (PQQ) in accordance with Vl.3 below.

EXECUTION_SERVICE_RESERVED_PARTICULAR_PR.P: Execution of the services will be reserved to suppliers offering the appropriate professional skills and qualifications, as applicable.

OPE_OBJECTIVE_CRITERIA.P: As stated in the PQQ evaluation criteria.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: In order to respond to this advert, Applicants must request, complete and submit to the Contracting Authority 2 hard copies and 1 Microsoft Office 2003 compatible (or equivalent) electronic copy on CD of a completed pre qualification questionnaire (PQQ) in respect of each Lot for which the applicant wishes to be considered as a potential tenderer (see III.2).
One separate copy of the applicant's last 2 years annual accounts should be submitted in respect of each applicant.
The pre qualification questionnaire can be obtained from: andrew.hrabi@dft.gsi.gov.uk.
Applicants may apply for one or more Lots.
Completed pre-qualification questionnaires must be received by Wednesday 2.3.2011.

The Department is seeking to appoint organisations who have a proven track record of providing and delivering a wide range of specialist transport-related technical and engineering advice, consultancy and research services. It is also seeking to secure access to specialists and academics in the research field. Applicants should be able to show that they can provide a broad range of relevant expertise and experience through both their own workforce and through established and/or proposed supply chains.
Whilst Small and Medium sized enterprises are welcome to compete for this Framework, they may also wish to consider working with other service providers.
The Framework may be used for central and local government funded work undertaken by Rail safety & standards board (RSSB), Technology Strategy Board (TSB), and similar bodies.
Work will also fall within service categories 8 and 10 (Section II.1.2 refers).

Work will be allocated to suppliers by the fair allocation by value of work across each Lot by a Framework Board (or similar body), or by further competition across eligible suppliers, subject to on-going acceptable performance of suppliers.

The Department intends to hold a briefing session in Great Minster House, 76 Marsham St, London SW1P 4DR, UNITED KINGDOM, at 10 am on Friday 4.2.2011. Applicants wishing to attend should e-mail: andrew.hrabi@dft.gsi.gov.uk.
The Framework shall have a duration of three years from award, with an option for the Authority to extend for up to one further year.

It should be noted that the department is working with the Efficiency and Reform Group in the cabinet office and any invitation to tender is likely to include price matching and other clauses to ensure that any advantages in any further Central UK Government framework can also be applied to this framework.
The Department reserves the right:
(a) not to award any contract as a result of the procurement process commenced by publication of this notice;
(b) to make whatever changes it may see fit to the content and structure of the tender competition;

In no circumstances will the Department be liable for any costs incurred by applicants and selected bidders in submitting a PQQ, and in tendering for the proposed framework or any further competitions within the framework.

Applicants must note that transparency requirements will be a condition of the proposed Framework Agreement and any orders placed under that agreement. Those requirements will permit the Contracting Authorities to publish the text of the agreement, any orders they place, and information contained within tenders, subject to possible redactions at the sole discretion of the Contracting Authority.
The department reserves the right to alter the number and composition of Lots prior to tender.
The framework agreement, including but not limited to any parent company guarantee, will be subject to English Law.
Requests for further information should be sent to:
andrew.hrabi@dft.gsi.gov.uk
GO Reference: GO-2011121-PRO-2133457.
